intro: Pentaphragma mindanaense, commonly known as the Mindanao bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is often found in forest understories. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
